page.title: 17VICARAGE FARM
page.content: Vicarage Farm, built in the early 1800s, is an arable farm. It has an area of 730 acres. It grows sugarbeet, potatoes, barley and wheat. On Thursday July 11th., 1985, a new sugarbeet harvester arrived, adding to the existing number of machines. It cost 69,000 pounds. Vicarage Farm has a grain store which can hold up to 850 tons of wheat. The grain is put to dry leaving only 16% of water in it or it will rot and then it cannot be sold. Some of the grain is used as feed for animals. On the farm is a water bore hole which is used for pumping water to the fields. It is used in irrigating the land. Most farmers need to have a form of irrigation to keep the crops watered as the weather is unreliable. Mr. Plant is the Farm Manager and it is owned by W.B. Chambers.
